title: Fossil fuel firms may have to pay for climate damage under proposed UN tax
content: Framework Convention on International Tax Cooperation could also force ultra-rich to pay global wealth tax Fossil fuel companies could be forced to pay some of the price of their damage to the climate, and the ultra-rich subjected to a global wealth tax, if new tax rules are agreed under the UN. title: The global rules-based order has been in freefall for years | Letters
content: Readers respond to an article by Gordon Brown in which he says the free world needs a new plan and strong leadership When we look at the actions of Russia, China, North Korea, Israel, Iran and now the US in recent years, there is a tendency to close our eyes tight, pull the covers over our heads and wait for the madness to go away. title: Even the Davos elites have woken up, but they need more than just speeches to survive the end of the old order | Nesrine Malik
content: Mark Carney and other custodians of the order are right to contemplate its death, but are they really willing to unpick the the entire system? When precisely did the rules-based order die? Mark Carney’s speech last week at Davos was the first time a western leader has said outright what has been hanging over political proceedings for some time. title: Israel agrees to ‘limited reopening’ of Gaza’s Rafah crossing once operation to locate hostage completed
content: The opening of the the Rafah crossing with Egypt is a key part of the US brokered ceasefire Israel said on Sunday its military was conducting a “large-scale operation” to locate the body of the last hostage in Gaza, adding that it would only reopen the Rafah crossing with Egypt after the mission was completed. title: The global rule of law is not collapsing – Trump is the lone problem and he can be defeated | Simon Tisdall
content: The president’s approval ratings are plummeting and most Americans see him as an aberration.
